intro: Casearia fuliginosa, commonly known as black casearia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Salicaceae family, which includes willows and poplars, and is characterized by its woody structure and compound leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color, and it bears small, spherical fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
